Description:
Some careers shine brighter than others.If you’re looking for a career that will help you stand out, join HSBC and fulfil your potential. Whether you want a career that could take you to the top, or simply take you in an exciting new direction, HSBC offers opportunities, support and rewards that will take you further.HSBC is one of the largest banking and financial services organisations in the world, with operations in 64 countries and territories. We aim to be where the growth is, enabling businesses to thrive and economies to prosper, and, ultimately, helping people to fulfil their hopes and realise their ambitions.We are currently seeking an experienced professional to join our team in the role of Consultant Specialist.Defining and implementing Project Strategies covering all testing activities within each project
Represent testing at all key project meetings and provide a single point of accountability and escalation for testing within the project
The development and ownership of testing documentation in line with HSBC standards
Managing the risk and the quality of deliverables against scope, budget and schedules
Provide on-going input into the overall process improvement of the Testing discipline within CDD
Establish effective working relationships with other areas of HSBC related in the end-to-end testing cycle (eg Business, Information Security & Risk, Change Delivery etc)
Provide the testing sign-off and recommendations for the production release
Lead the test team by providing a proper vision with a confirmed plan, strategy and a clear action
Ensure development projects are delivered on time, meet business requirements and fulfil end-user requirements. Assist with identifying and resolving systems issues.
Implement, maintain and improve test team principles and strategy that address all aspects of the Test process.
Ensure the test function follows an auditable robust process where controls can be evidenced.
Enhance processes without adding unnecessary red tape or admin overhead..
Ensure test automation is used effectively to minimise test cycle timescales while maintaining high quality standards.
Coach project and scrum teams in proper test procedure, review techniques used for all types of testing practiced in the test function.
Produce project estimates and work closely with the Development Manager to ensure project work is delivered to required timescales and quality levels.
Work alongside business analysts, scrum masters and project managers to understand business goals/drivers and deliver testing artefacts to the required timescales.
Provide regular reports to senior management to demonstrate progress of the test function.
Participate in project meetings with business stakeholders to understand and deliver projects.
Responsible for test improvement and optimisation
Promote and advocate test capabilities internally
Take responsibility for talent, succession planning and able to manage federated test teams
Take accountability to drive positive energy, motivation within test teams and take care of wellbeing
Make important decisions relating to test within the context of the delivery environment
Develop test strategy for both manual and automated testing ( functional, non-functional) covering tools, technology people and process
Proven track record of implementing and executing an assurance and test strategy and leading testing activities on large integration projects
Identification of test entry and exit criteria
Good experience of test planning, reporting, co-ordination and execution of test activities
Defect management across all test phases and remediation activities
Good exposure of software/product test approaches
Strong stakeholder engagement and communication skills
Experience of testing toolsJob Details
